intro: Alyxia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Alyxia flavescens is typically found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in coastal areas.
